definitions.definition: To disconnect from a supply , especially an electrical socket.
examples: To save electricity, I unplug my computer when I am not at home.

definitions.definition: To stop using electronic devices, especially for relaxation or to reduce stress .
To remove a blockage from (especially a water pipe or drain ).
examples: I had to unplug the sink the other day: there was far too much hair and gunk down there.

definitions.definition: To temporarily disconnect from worldly experiences .
examples: I need to unplug and spend some time with my family.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To disconnect from a supply , especially an electrical socket.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To stop using electronic devices, especially for relaxation or to reduce stress .
( transitive ) To remove a blockage from (especially a water pipe or drain ).
( idiomatic , intransitive ) To temporarily disconnect from worldly experiences .
